Renkow, M., & Rubin, A. R. (1998). Does municipal solid waste composting make economic sense?. Journal of Environmental Management, 53(4), 339-347.
Assumptions: Variable costs for the landfill are assumed to be $8·40 per ton of waste handled. Variable costs for MSW composting are computed by applying an assumed rate of $27 per ton (the average variable cost net of revenues from this survey) to the amount of waste being composted.

Assumptions: The composting system accepts approximately 617 tons of wastes per day and the costs are for 4,2 years
